entry.title: IDEA: Hire Some One To Get Hired
entry.content:
Idea

Hire Some One To Get Hired

  • Feels weird right!

Past couple of months I have been thinking of getting hired or trying to get hired by some Remote companies.

Remember the word "Remote" Here

I wasn't getting any interview calls or any referrals on tech twitter space which is a bit weird for my profile. Despite the fact my proof of work is too strong (that is what I think, other opinions don't matter to me) and I have been active on tech twitter/x space for the past 2 months. Still don't know what was happening to either the market or twitter/x account outreach.

So, I started thinking of hiring someone to get hired. Maybe it feels dumb but it's just an idea and I am not sure if it will work or not. But I can hire a simple guy who has access to all my resources and references and access to all my social accounts and instead of me doing all the work, he can do it for me. I am talking about cold outreach, DMing, etc. Right!

What do you think of this idea ??

And please don't talk about AI or any sort of tooling or automations! No, I wouldn't allow that much access to it or don't want something that I cannot control.

How's the idea?

PS: I am still looking for Job

Thank You!

entry.title: GPU Passthrough
entry.content:
GPU Passthrough [qemu-kvm-vifo-pci]

[An unsuccessful attempt]

Example/Explanation Demo Video here!

This video is so amazing, once you watch it you will love how seamlessly you can switch between Linux to Windows VM. Which is passed through your GPU output and getting displayed on the monitor and running parallel via a single setup!

I tried to do the same thing with my laptop which is [Acer-Aspire-07-5500U-1650gtxGPU]!

As a tech nerd I did all the research: YouTube, documentation, vfio, PCI outputs and everything.

I moved towards the configuring my laptop and found out that my HDMI output is connected to my AMD-i-gpu not the dedicated 1650-d-gtx-GPU.

Suddenly I started hating my laptop choice but later on I got to know about Single-GPU passthrough but this time.

I Found out that Internal-GPUs are not capable of it.

The video/point I got jealous at is here!

Take Aways

  • don't Know
  • just learn stuff

Later on I left researching about thing and thought of building my own PC! But this is another pain in the butt so watched some videos and realized this will cost money so left research here...

WOW so much time i wasted........! dammmm bro NOT on research BUT on watching videos.

and this is An unsuccessful attempt of GPU passthrough.

Thank You!
